summary: The 'Preventing Deep Fake Scams Act' (H.R. 1734) aims to establish a Task Force on Artificial Intelligence in the Financial Services Sector. This task force, composed of key financial regulatory figures, will study the use of AI in the financial sector, focusing on the risks of deep fakes and other AI-driven fraud. The task force will report to Congress with recommendations on best practices, definitions, and legislative actions to protect consumers from data theft, identity theft, and fraud. The report must be delivered within one year of the bill's enactment.
